Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hungry \Hun"gry\, a. [Compar. {Hungrier}; superl. {Hungriest}.] [AS. hungrid. See {Hunger}.] 1. Feeling hunger; having a keen appetite; feeling uneasiness or distress from want of food; hence, having an eager desire. [1913 Webster]
2. Showing hunger or a craving desire; voracious. [1913 Webster]
The cruel, hungry foam. --C. Kingsley. [1913 Webster]
Cassius has a lean and hungry look. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
3. Not rich or fertile; poor; barren; starved; as, a hungry soil. ``The hungry beach.'' --Shak. [1913 Webster]

hungry adj 1: feeling hunger; feeling a need or desire to eat food; "a world full of hungry people" [ant: {thirsty}] 2: (usually followed by `for') extremely desirous; "athirst for knowledge"; "hungry for recognition"; "thirsty for informaton" [syn: {athirst(p)}, {hungry(p)}, {thirsty(p)}] [also: {hungriest}, {hungrier}]
